module.title: Resource: EventQueue
module.description:
Basic event queue.
Allows to store events in database to be handled later by an other module or process.
module.author: Christian Würker
module.sql: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `<%?prefix%>events`; CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `<%?prefix%>events` ( `eventId` int(10) UNSIGNED NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, `creatorId` int(10) UNSIGNED DEFAULT '0', `status` tinyint(1) UNSIGNED DEFAULT '0' COMMENT '0:new, 1:revoked, 2:ignored, 3:running, 4:failed, 5:succeeded', `scope` varchar(63) COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL, `identifier` varchar(63) COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci NOT NULL, `origin` varchar(127) COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL, `handler` varchar(63) COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL, `data` text COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci, `result` text COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci, `createdAt` decimal(12,0) UNSIGNED NOT NULL, `modifiedAt` decimal(12,0) UNSIGNED DEFAULT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`eventId`), KEY `creatorId` (`creatorId`), KEY `status` (`status`), KEY `identifier` (`identifier`), KEY `scope` (`scope`) ) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COLLATE=utf8_unicode_ci;
